headline: Hot Spinach Artichoke Dip
description: This spinach artichoke dip is deliciously cheesy, creamy, and easy to make! Serve this flavorful dip hot with toasted bread or tortilla chips.

video.name: How to Make Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip

name: Hot Spinach Artichoke Dip
recipeIngredient: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
0.5 cup frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a small baking dish.
Mix cream cheese, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, Romano cheese, garlic, basil, garlic salt, salt, and pepper together in a medium bowl. Gently stir in artichoke hearts and spinach.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish; top with mozzarella cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Recipe, as is, is ok but i carmelized onions, and garlic. Added it to two cups of thawed spinach, added more grated cheese as well as roasted red peppers and 1/4 cup mexican blend cheese. Also topped with grated parmesan cheese. It turned out amazing. Roasted red peppers gave it a smokey flavor component and depth. The mexican blend didnt add much flavor so it can be subbed out for your favorite cheese.
Great recipe as is.
Soooo good! I roasted my garlic and used equal parts of sour cream and mayo as opposed to just mayo. I served with crostini. Yummy!!!!

We bring this to every cook out, and when we're making it for yourselves, my husband barely allows it to get out of the oven before he digs in. We always make double. Great recipe! On hot days, we cook it on the stove in a cast iron and use fresh spinach. Comes out just as lovely!
Absolutely delicious
I have made this twice the first time it was a hit and the second time I doubled the recipe and it was a success will keep this one

Great recipe but it did have one drawback. They layer of mozzarella over the top was too thick and made dipping impossible. Next time I will incorporate the mozzarella into the dip with a thin layer on top.
This spinach, hot dish was a big hit with my family. I will make it again and again.

This is the best Spinach Artichoke dip I've ever had! I followed the recipe, except topped it with cheddar. It was easy and quick to make. I brought it as an appetizer with veggies for Christmas and it was loved by all! I will definitely be making this often!
I makde a few small alterations, like more garlic and mozzerella. Yum. It is amazing ðŸ¤©

Family loved it even tho I did leave out the artichokes bc I forgot to get them at my local grocery before this "Storm of the Century" here in my mountain state!! And I'm not going anywhere!! Dec 22, 2022
Made for Thanksgiving, with mayo ,devoured instantly, everyone wanted the recipe, making a double batch for Christmas, gonna try one with the sour cream to compare. Yummy and easy!

This has been a favorite in our family for years, I make it for nearly every holiday gathering. I sometimes use a blend of Italian cheeses for the top instead of just mozzarella, but either way is delicious.

Creamy, chunky and oh so warming my husband exclaimed. We loved that the dip stayed warm the more you dipped down into its gooeyness. I used a 4 cheese blend instead of Romano cheese. Also, added 1 teaspoon of granulated garlic with parsley and used fresh spinach. We served this Everything crackers, sesame crackers, toasted garlic French bread, toasted and untoasted pita chips, and shredded wheat crackers. It was easy to warm up on day 2 with a moistened paper towel to cover and reheat in the microwave. I would make this again and again!

I went pretty far off script on this recipe. I used fresh spinach (stemmed then chopped), LOTS of garlic, and greek yogurt instead of mayo. It came out delicious albeit less creamy due to my omission of the mayonnaise.
We liked it but did not love it. I would tweak recipe next time. It needs a little something to make it great

This is the best spinach artichoke dip recipe weâ€™ve found on the site. Everyone loves it, and it goes fast! I mix everything up pretty well, then add the artichokes, so as not to mash them. I then mix them in and bake. Really delicious!
i've had better, needs something...maybe some peppers of some sort. but we still ate it all :-)

I absolutely LOVE this recipe!! I started making it a little over a year ago and fell in love with it. I now make it for thanksgiving, mothers/Fatherâ€™s Day, graduations, & just lazy days at home. So far my husband, parents, sister, grandma in law, mother in law, and father in law all love it!! I have had nothing but compliments on it. Now when we go to Applebees we are disappointed with their spinach dip! Lol. I will never make it any other way. Thanks so much for this!!
This is delicious! I make it for an get-together we are having and everyone loves it!
No Romano so doubled parm. I do 3 cloves of garlic. This is a crowd pleaser every time.
Added extra cheese used shredded parmasean instead of grated used extra garlic, also tarragon instead of basil. Turned out fabulous.

Amazing! I loved it ðŸ¥°. I used almost 2 cups of fresh spinach finely chopped. Used 2 cloves of garlic minced. Skipped the Romano cheese. I opted for miracle whip in olive oil than mayonnaise. Didnâ€™t have mayonnaise and never use it. The artichokes needed to be fully drained and chopped fine, the jar I had were in olive oil, vinegar and oregano. Got a bit tangier taste. But overall itâ€™s a hit to please any crowd. Would love to make it again.
This is absolutely delicious!!! I added a few extra cloves of garlic and a bit more of the Romano and Mozzarella cheeses, and it was wonderful!!! I will for sure be making this again!!!!!!!
I liked it but put my own spin on it, added a 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper and also put mozzarella in the dip! Turned out top shelf restaurant quality!
The best everâ€¦ so many compliments.. better than any restaurant!!
Iâ€™m a big spinach artichoke dip guy. With that saidâ€¦ Itâ€™s just all right. Have had better. Canâ€™t put my finger on what it is specifically but is just mediocre.
added jalapenos

This is a great recipe, I added more garlic, 4 small cloves instead of 1. The only cheese I had is Parmesian so I added 1 cup and then 1/4cup on top. This turned out great. I also cook this longer to brown the top about 45 minutes.

Not creamy, lacks flavor. I added more salt and pepper. That didnâ€™t help. Added a splash of hot sauce, not much better. Tried stirring and adding more mozzarella cheese, baking longer. Still blah. Glad I wasnâ€™t taking it to a party!

I had everything but Romano cheese because the store didn't have it, and I used sour cream instead of Mayo and this was my first time making spinach artichoke dip ever and it was AMAZING, like more amazing than I thought it would be! Will definitely make again and hopefully have Romano next time.
Turned out great. Family loved it.
This dip is always a big hit for friends and family! They request it often.

Omg !!!!! amazing I typically really donâ€™t enjoy eating spinach and artichoke even though I know it is really good for you, but, I just made this recipe and I just canâ€™t stop eating it. 

It is so good that this will be my go-to snack if I really want something healthy as well as delicious.
This was a huge hit at our gathering. We will definitely make this again!
It came out perfect and delicious! Broiled it for a few minutes after it baked to get the nice brown on top.
Delicious dip. Added some sour cream.
Made as stated but added cayenne for a kick. Served with various crackers, bread and veggies!

The flavor was excellent even though I didn't have any mozzarella cheese. I had a small can of water chestnuts I chopped for some crunch. I think I'll try an addition of 1/4 cup sour cream along with the mayo next time for a creamier texture.

It was a hit at Thanksgiving yesterday! The one thing I changed was the amount of time in the oven. It called for 25 minutes, but I wanted to see more browning on the top of it. So, I let it cook for 5-10 more minutes and it was better.

Substitute mayo with sour cream
Double the spinach it calls for
Really good. Subbed most of the mayo for sour cream and mixed the mozzarella cheese into the dip.
I used sour cream i stead of Mayo and oh it was good! I made this with supper one night and it was gone!! Will definitely make again! Definitely a keeper!
soooo!!! delicious

I followed the suggestion from countless reviews to use sour cream instead of mayonnaise. Very good recipe. I only gave it a 4 star bc I think the ratio of artichoke and spinach to the base of the dip is too much. I ended up doubling the cream cheese and sour cream and cheeses to accommodate the amount of vegetables. Nobody was mad that there was more dip but still. Another note, Iâ€™m not enjoying the basil in this dip. And I highly recommend a little cayenne pepper. Maybe 1/4 tsp.
This dip is amazing!! Just like what you would get at a restaurant. Will definitely be making again and again.
I made this as per recipe. The most delicious artichoke spinach dip ever! This is a keeper ????
Superb as written!!

Always a big hit every time I make this! This is by far the best recipe I have found. We add a little more basil leaves and garlic, but the recipe is flawless. Very easy and delicious, the dish is always empty. We pair it with the naan bread dippers.
This artichoke & spinach dip is GREAT! It's easy to make and everyone loves it!

Fantastic dip! This was my first time making and trying spinach artichoke dip, and my first time trying artichokes. I'm very very happy with how the recipe turned out, but I did add a few strips of bacon and bacon drippings, and I added sharp cheddar to the mix. Other than those additions, this recipe will be my go-to for spinach artichoke dip.

This recipe is yummy and easy. I tried to follow it closely, but had to make a few changes based on what was on hand. I used neufchÃ¢tel instead of cream cheese. I doubled the amount of parmesan, because I didn't have romano. I used a 10 oz. package of frozen spinach; thawed and squeezed dry. I added a 1/4 c of plain greek yogurt. I omitted the mozzarella, because I didn't bake it. Everything else in the recipe stayed the same. I let it sit in the refrigerator a few hours before serving. It's delicious with a fresh relish tray (carrots, celery, sweet peppers, etc.); also good on crackers and pita chips. The raw garlic and salty parmesan give it a punch of flavor.
Not sure what I did wrong as I followed it as directed but it was too dry. I usually love everything I make on this site but this was a total dud for us.

I brought this to a girls night and it was good, but I have to say, it was GREAT the 2nd day! My family couldn't stop eating it! After reading the reviews, I did substitute the sour cream for the mayo (I used an 8oz cup to ensure it wasn't dry) and I added extra artichokes only because I enjoy it that way. AWESOME recipe!!
My family love it! Easy to make, not too many ingredients and my family couldn't get enough. I will definitely make it again!
Absolutely delicious. Made it for a party and it was devoured. I should have doubled the batch.
This recipe is amazingly delicious!!!! Itâ€™s so good I canâ€™t order spinach dip from the restaurants because theirs suck compared to this
I made this just as the recipe stated for the Super Bowl. It was a winner with the family. Forgot to take a picture.
For me it had to much artichoke in it and not enough sauce.

This was the best Spinach Artichoke dip I've ever had and my significant other said the same. I didn't veer from the recipe much. The only thing I did differently was to sautÃ© some fresh baby spinach vs frozen and added some paprika and onion powder. It only took about 10 minutes in our air fryer at 350. It came out nice and brown on the top.
Delicious
I added garlic powder and salt to taste, rather than a garlic clove and garlic salt. I also added water chestnuts to give a little crunch. It tasted amazing!
I made this for New Years Eve and everyone loved it! It was creamy and rich with a nice blend of flavors. I added a half cup of shredded gruyere because I had it on hand and thought, why not?
I thought the flavor was good - I used fresh spinach but other than that I followed the recipe. A little too much cream cheese for me (maybe half the amount of cream cheese would be good).
This was easy to make and delicious! I added chopped water chestnuts and chopped green onions(scallions). mushrooms would be good too! served with tortilla chips. very filling! Happy New year

This is the best spinach dip recipe I have found! I have tried so many different recipes and they were all just bland. I was looking for a spinach dip recipe that tasted like the ones you order in the restaurant. This recipe is great but after making it a couple of times I experimented just a little. I added a half envelope of Knorrs Leek Soup mix to this recipe and WOW, it tasted just like a spinach dip that was made in a restaurant. Thank you for this wonderful recipe!

I have made this recipe for years! It is a high requested dip for every family event. The only difference is I am never able to find Romano cheese so instead I just add extra mozzarella and Parmigian to make up for it and I use fresh spinach not frozen. It is AMAZING.
Absolutely delicious! I added 1/4 cup sour cream and 2 heaping tablespoons of mayonnaise, few dashes of Worcestershire sauce and hot sauce! A keeper!
soooo good! I used sour cream instead of the mayo and added more cheese. I also took the suggestion to mix the Mozza cheese in and then bake it vs leaving it on the top.

Followed the recipe with no modifications (I used jarred garlic and garlic powder since i didn't have fresh garlic or garlic-salt) but holy wow... better than any restaurant I've ever had it at! Will be making it again (and again and again)
Turned out great! I added 1/2 tsp crushed red pepper and used sour cream instead of Mayo. Delish!
Made this as an app for my sons 18th birthday and it turned out great. Thank for the great recipe.

I followed the recipe except I mixed in the mozzarella and it was delicious! Iâ€™m sure any slight alterations wonâ€™t drastically affect the outcome, but I wanted to try it as intended before getting creative. So yummy!
Yummy !
This is simple to make and by far my favorite!
Followed recipe as is. Definitely a hit. Will make again and again. Thank you for sharing.

I had everything but the basil, substituting lactose free where I could, I.e. lactose-free cream cheese. For the basil, I substituted salad herbs. My teens loved it, and weâ€™ve found another appetizer that wonâ€™t require the math for Lactaid!
This recipe is amazing!!! My family absolutely loved it. I honestly donâ€™t want to try any others now. We tired a few before and were disappointed, but this one is a keeper. Thank you for sharing!
This was a hit! We've been asked for the recipe and will be making it again for ourselves.
Very yummy. Everyone enjoyed. It is best to eat hot. It was perfect and I did not change a thing! I would definitely make this again!
delicious!!
Amazing. Added mozzarella at the end of the cooking until melted.
Over all really good.
yum!
It's delicious!! Was super easy to make, and I'm currently devoiring it. My honey made it in less than an hour.
Fantastic

I love this recipe! I have made it several times! I use frozen artichokes and chop them thaw them and drain them kinda like the spinach. And I'm extra generous with the cheese, especially the topper, I like to add some Romano and parmesan to the top! Highly recommend you try this recipe!
Love this dip! I substituted sour cream for the mayo and like it better without the basil.
BEST spinach artichoke dip out there. Excellent flavor and easy to make. Have made this several times and there is never a bite left over. Love it.
I made this, it was GREAT! I replaced Romano cheese with Sour Cream.
This was amazing very rich...

This is a great version of this dip, without adding all of the fat from a bottled alfredo sauce. Kicked it up a notch by using fresh, cooked spinach in place of frozen chopped. Makes it more moist, and reheats fabulous.
Good flavor, however, I found this to be on the dry side and not creamy as I had expected. Giving it 3 stars because the flavor was good.
Love this recipe! I pour about 1/4 of the canâ€™s artichoke juice into the bowl and mix with the rest of ingredients listed in recipe.
wow good!!

This dish is quite honestly delicious! So simple yet so exquisite with flavors. We typically use ever recipe as a base and spice it up with our own twist but opted to keep it simple due to the reviews we read. They were right! The only thing we added was white pepper and I think that's all it needed. For those who haven't experimented with white pepper, it provides such a beautiful, light flavor while also adding the perfect amount of spice. Highly recommend. But anyways. If you're doubting this simple recipe's ability to wow you, don't! This is the first Greek dish we've tried and we will be adding this to our regular rotation. The zucchini and potato complement each other perfectly, what one lacks in texture the other provides. The onion and tomato are great supporters in flavor as well. Overall extremely impressed. Will make many times over and believe this would be a hit at any dinner gathering. Be prepared to use multiple baking dishes and have lot's of leftovers, this has a huge yield! That was great for us because we meal prep so I'll be able to enjoy this a few more times later this week!!

It tastes great! 
You should make it with normal spinach instead of frozen.
Eat it with sourdough bread or crackers.!!!!!

This is the best Spinach Artichoke dip ever. Better than any restaurant. I have never put the dried basil in it but other than that I make it exactly as listed and my kids love it. I serve with toasted baguette slices. Mmmmm, rich, creamy, perfect.
Turned out perfect.
